wikipedia_page.main: Edmund Ian Marshall (born 31 May 1940) is a British politician and churchman.

link_mentions.page: List of presidents of the Methodist Conference

response: The original Labour First formed in 1980 as a grouping of MPs on the right of the Labour Party who, while politically aligned with fellow Labour right faction, The Manifesto Group, desired a more collegiate party and thought that the left-right factional battles of the 1970s and 1980s were damaging the party's electoral prospects.  The group's chair was Brynmor John and its secretary was Edmund Marshall.  By 1983 the grouping had effectively merged into the Labour Solidarity Campaign, the successor to The Manifesto Group.
